H0.text: What is the name for the infection of living tissues such as skin, lung or bowel by bacteria. Bacteremia

H1.text: What is the name for the infection of living tissues such as skin, lung or bowel by bacteria. Pyemia

H2.text: What is the name for the infection of living tissues such as skin, lung or bowel by bacteria. Toxemia

H3.text: What is the name for the infection of living tissues such as skin, lung or bowel by bacteria. Sepsis

A4.text: Bacteremia is the presence of bacteria in the bloodstream that are alive and capable of reproducing.

A5.text: Sepsis is characterized by severe inflammatory or immune responses of the host organism to pathogens.

A6.text: Pyaemia is a type of sepsis that leads to widespread abscesses of a metastatic nature.

A7.text: It is usually caused by the pus-forming organisms in the blood.

A9.text: Sepsis is caused by a combination of factors related to the particular invading pathogen(s) and the status of the immune system of the host.
